feed.title: Living Link Lab
feed.subtitle: The Living Link Lab is a platform at the University of Virginia that enables long term naturalistic occupant studies.

entry.title: Health, well-being and productivity of Link Lab Residents

link.title: Health, well-being and productivity of Link Lab Residents

entry.content:
The project aims at understanding the relationship between environmental as well as human contexts and health, well-being and productivity of individuals working in Link Lab.

As people go about their daily lives, their everyday experience captured using actively and passively collected data from smartphones, smartwatches or other smart devices could prove promising for assessing their health, well-being and productivity. People spend a major portion of their day at work and it is estimated that the life expectancy of people in a stressful environment reduces. Also, environmental stress can cause a decline in productivity and have negative effects on health and well-being. Thus, in this project we will try to understand how everyday human experience as captured by smart devices relates with the well-being of Link Lab residents in the context of different environmental conditions.

Team members:

Faculty

  • Arsalan Heydarian
  • Laura Barnes
  • Afsaneh Doryab

Graduate Students

PhD Students
  • Alan Wang
  • Navreet Kaur
  • Xiang Guo
entry.summary: The project aims at understanding the relationship between environmental as well as human contexts and health, well-being and productivity of individuals working in Link Lab.

entry.title: Welcome to the Living Link Lab!

link.title: Welcome to the Living Link Lab!

entry.content:
We are soft launching the Living Link Lab framework!

We are testing the following:

  1. That the sensors all work as expected
  2. That the website works with each link
  3. Test the navigation of users through our information site

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyllâ€™s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll Talk.
entry.summary: We are soft launching the Living Link Lab framework!
